1--.text: Talk to a merchant from time to time. Remember, once you speak with a merchant, you're committed to purchasing something.

3--.text: Clicking Instant Restock updates the shop with new merchandise.

5--.text: If you want to lease land, click the house icon in front of the site.

6--.text: Clicking the [My House] button immediately moves you to the inside of your house.

7--.text: The Adventurer Housing Policy allows each player to have a house.

8--.text: You can place an entrance to your home on any land you lease.

9--.text: Visit other people's houses and sign their guest books.

10--.text: You can receive decoration gifts every day. The more elaborate your home decor, the better the gifts will be!

11--.text: The higher the level of interior decorating, the more furnishings you can add.

12--.text: You can purchase furniture in Build Mode. Show off your decorating skills!

13--.text: In Build Mode you can decorate freely, even if you do not own any furnishings.

14--.text: Home plans can be saved and used again later.

15--.text: You can change your home's mood or set a password in Build Mode under My House settings.

16--.text: You can change the rules of your house in Build Mode under My House settings.

17--.text: The size and height of a house can be adjusted in Build Mode.

18--.text: Decoration gifts can only be received once a day. Try to raise your decoration score as high as possible before receiving the gift.

19--.text: Press the B key while on your property to launch Build Mode. You can then place items on your property.

20--.text: Decorate your own home by arranging some furnishings.

21--.text: You can rotate items placed on your property to face any direction you like.

22--.text: You can buy and install furnishings while in Build Mode.

26-UGCMapRenewal-.text: When you leave a house, you'll always return to your original location.

27-UGCMapRenewal-.text: Some furnishings can be placed after earning a special trophy.

28--.text: There might be special effects of placing souvenirs in your home!

29--.text: You can place a mannequin on your property and dress it up with equipment. Try changing up its look every now and then.

30--.text: You can turn the TV installed on your property on or off.

31--.text: You can design and create your own items in the Maple Workshop.

32--.text: You can design Build Items, just as you can design outfits.

34--.text: You can make an item with your own name on it, and show it off around Maple World!

35--.text: Express your personality with customizable items.

37--.text: Visit $map:02000107$ if you want to switch up your style.

38--.text: You can change your appearance at the Hair Salon and Plastic Surgery Office $map:02000107$.

39--.text: Visit $map:02000107$ when you want a fresh new look, whether it be for your hair, face, skin tone, or something else.

40--.text: Visit $map:52000010$ in $map:02000107$ to change your face.

41--.text: Visit $map:52000008$ in $map:02000107$ to change your hair.

42--.text: Speak with $npcName:11000256$ in $map:52000008$ on $map:02000107$ for some great new make-up.

43--.text: $npcName:11000257$ in $map:52000009$ claims that your equipment can be dyed any color.

44--.text: Change your hair, face, and skin in $map:02000107$!

45--.text: You can upload images to the displays throughout towns to share them with others.

46--.text: To upload an image to a display, you must make a reservation at least 3 hours in advance.

47--.text: There are displays throughout the world where you can reserve time slots to display images to others.

48--.text: Anyone can reserve time slots on a display.

49--.text: Press the Set Portrait button to change your character's portrait.

50--.text: When you arrive in a new town, the first thing to do is head over to the equipment shop.

51--.text: Express yourself by performing an emote with the F1 - F12 keys.

51--NA.text: Express yourself by performing an emote with the F1 - F5 keys.

52--.text: Special furnishings like trigger editors and mannequins cannot be used in the Decor Planner, only placed.

53--.text: Don't be fooled by a slime's cute appearance.

54--.text: You don't need arrows for your bow.

55--.text: You don't need to restock your thrown weapons.

56--.text: You need spirit to use active skills.

59--.text: Register your newly learned skill to a quickslot for ease of use.

61--.text: Other players can break your tombstone to revive you on the spot.

62--.text: Register your newly acquired items to the quickslots for ease of use.

64--.text: You can equip different thrown weapons to each of your hands.

65--.text: You can equip thrown weapons to both your hands.

66--.text: You can equip a different dagger to your left and right hands.

67--.text: You can equip a different dagger to each of your hands.

70--.text: After reviving, you will be Tombshocked for some time. Wait it out, or see a doctor.

71--.text: If your health reaches 0 again while you still have the Tombshocked status, you will be under a metal tombstone.

72--.text: After being tombstoned, you may choose to revive in place by spending mesos.

74--.text: A magic hat sometimes appears on non-town maps. Enter the hat to discover a Pocket Realm hiding inside.

75--.text: Enter the magic hats found out in the world to discover special mini-games and encounters!

76--.text: Iron Hog's armor is famed for its sturdiness.

77--.text: Ironically, there are no ants in the Ant Tunnel.

78--.text: $npcName:22000022$, the ruler of the Winding Canyon, is female.

80--.text: Eat an herb to gradually recover your health over time.

81--.text: You cannot use potions when your health is full.

84--.text: You can change your keyboard settings in the Key Binding tab under Options.

87--.text: Try jumping at a wall. Yep, you can hang on walls.

89--.text: Press the Alt or C key to jump.

90--.text: Press the Ctrl or X key to attack.

92--.text: You can pick up items by pressing the Z key.

93--.text: While near a ladder, press the up arrow on your keyboard to cling to the ladder.

94--.text: In $map:02000083$, you will not be fined for destruction of public property, even if you pull stoplights right out of the ground and swing them about!

97--.text: You can learn a lot of information by utilizing the world map.

98--.text: You can find the location of taxi stops on the world map.

99--.text: Open the world map to see which maps have quests you can accept.

100--.text: Open the world map to see your current location.

101--.text: Open the world map to see where a boss appeared.

102--.text: Curious to know which spots are booming right now? Check out the popular locations on the world map.

103--.text: Doctors are usually found in big cities or hospitals.

104--.text: Receive treatment from a doctor to get back in tip-top shape!

105--.text: You can use skill points to learn a new skill or upgrade an existing one. Open your skill window to get started.

110--.text: You can achieve titles by winning trophies.

113--.text: Interact with a taxi stop to take a cab to any previously discovered taxi stop.

114--.text: Reach level 25 to use a deluxe taxi.

115--.text: Deluxe taxis arrive as soon as you call them.

116--.text: Use the Rotors Air Taxi to instantly travel anywhere on the World Map.

117--.text: Right-click a character to do any number of things, like whisper, trade, send a party invite, or add a friend.

118--.text: Try right-clicking a passerby and sending a party invite.

119--.text: 10 is the maximum number of party members.

120--.text: The community window displays players logged into the same map as you.

121--.text: You can add friends through the community window, or by right-clicking their characters.

122--.text: You can send a party invite by right-clicking a character.

123--.text: To stop all messages from a character, right-click the character and select the block function.

124--.text: You can trade by right-clicking a character.

125--.text: Press Tab to enlarge the minimap.

126--.text: Hover the mouse over the minimap's icons to view the names of NPCs and maps.

127--.text: The settings button in the minimap's upper right corner allows you to display or hide information.

128--.text: The top of the minimap shows which characters are logged into the same map.

131--.text: Some monsters can be grabbed if you're close enough to them.

133--.text: Double-click a mount to ride it.

134--.text: Save a mount to a quickslot, then press the corresponding key to ride it.

135--.text: Press the X key while atop your mount to use its unique skill.

137-UGCMapRenewal-.text: When you're in your house, you can use your safe or call a primary physician whenever you want.

138-UGCMapRenewal-.text: When you log out from your home, you will accrue rest experience.

139--.text: Right-click in the chat window to open up chat settings.

140--.text: Open your inventory and shift-click an item to link it to the chat window.

141--.text: Press Tab key while typing a chat message to easily change the message recipient.

142--.text: You need merets to use the world megaphone or the channel megaphone in the chat window.

143--.text: You can defeat monsters faster if you team up with party members.

144--.text: If you pass a stranger fighting an elite or boss monster,  lend a helping hand!

145--.text: If you run into an elite or boss monster, use teamwork to defeat it.

146--.text: When you're up against an elite or boss monster, it's best to fight alongside others.

147--.text: If you and another player fight an elite or boss monster together, you can still obtain loot. No need to be in a party!

148--.text: You can receive a reward when fighting an elite or boss monster, even if you are not in the same party as others.

150--.text: You cannot earn experience while tombstoned.

151--.text: When reviving after being tombstoned, you will be immune to harm for a short period.

152--.text: To revive a tombstoned player, attack their tombstone until its health gauge is depleted.

153--.text: When you are defeated after recently reviving, you will be pinned under an indestructable metal tombstone.

154--.text: You cannot free other players from under a metal tombstone.

155--.text: Walk when traveling short distances. It's the healthy thing to do!

156--.text: Be sure to check your mail in case a special item arrives.

157--.text: There's a rumor that $map:2000001$'s guards are twins, but it's not true.

159--.text: $npcName:11000106$ is kind only to her man.

160--.text: When you see a lever in front of you... Don't think, just pull it.

161--.text: To see yourself better, use the mouse wheel to zoom the camera.

162--.text: If you venture off the beaten path, you might just find some treasure chests.

163-UGCMapRenewal-.text: You receive rest experience while you are in your home.

164--.text: Items and mesos on the floor for more than 90 seconds will disappear. It's the 90-second rule!

165--.text: No X marks the spot in this case! To find a treasure chest, you'll have to look carefully where you normally wouldn't.

166--.text: Report inappropriate pictures on displays by right-clicking them.

167--.text: Type /partyinvite charactername (or /pinvite) in the chat window to invite that character to the party.

168--.text: Type /partyleave in the chat window to leave your current party.

169--.text: Try pressing the G key to found a new guild.

170--.text: Found a guild with a friend, one you have chemistry with!

171--.text: Guild trophies include all guild members' trophies.

172--.text: The Flag of Honor at $map:02000001$ displays the Rank 1 guild trophy, Rank 1 personal trophy, and Rank 1 of the Maple Arena.

173--.text: The Flag of Honor at $map:02000100$ displays the guild emblems of whoever holds the guild trophies at Ranks 1, 2, and 3.

174--.text: The Flag of Honor at $map:02000023$ displays the character portraits the top 3 ranked individuals in the category of Personal Trophies.

175--.text: The Flag of Honor at $map:02000064$ displays the top-three ranked guild and personal trophies.

176--.text: The Flag of Honor at $map:02000051$ displays the guild emblems of those at Ranks 1, 2, and 3 in the Maple Arena.

177--.text: The Flag of Honor at $map:02000051$ displays the guild emblems of those at Ranks 1, 2, and 3 in the Guild Championship.

178--.text: The Flag of Honor is updated once a day.

179--.text: Check the Flag of Honor, and you'll be able to see detailed rankings in Maview.

180-UGCMapRenewal-.text: When you call up a saved template, the existing furnishings will be cleared and the new furnishings will be placed.

181--.text: Type /guildinvite charactername (or /ginvite) in the chat window to invite that character to the guild.

186--.text: $npcName:11000508$, the blacksmith at $map:02000203$, can make items even stronger.

188--.text: In combat with other players, enchanted equipment is counterbalanced.

190--.text: $npcName:11000511$ is the only daughter of the Shuabritze lord.

193-NAstringMassive-.text: High-level characters can fight one-on-one at $map:65000001$.

194-NAstringMassive-.text: The winner at $map:65000001$ will continue to face challengers.

195-NAstringMassive-.text: Up to 10 people can fight at $map:65000002$.

199--.text: Report anyone that's harming the experience of other players.

200--.text: If you see an inappropriate image on a display, you can right-click it to report it.

201--.text: If you report someone using inappropriate language, that person's chat will be blinded.

202--.text: If you report an inappropriate character portrait or display image, that image will be immediately hidden.

203--.text: $npcName:11000514$ has never allowed even a single escape.

204--.text: There's a rumor circling that if you pay $npcName:11000514$ bail money, you'll be released from prison.

205--.text: Be careful! False reports are punishable.

206--.text: Repeatedly causing harm to others will result in a penalty.

207--.text: Those who break the rules and get a Penalty can no longer chat, use UGC, and more.

208--.text: If you participate in prison labor, you can more quickly be relieved from your penalty.

209--.text: False reports could lead to the reporter going to prison.

210--.text: $npcName:11000585$ at $map:02000062$ is giving a tour of the prison.

215--.text: Invite friends or guild members to have a group chat.

216--.text: At $map:02000216$, items that are epic or of high rarity can be traded.

217--.text: The fact that the Blackstar is running $map:02000216$ is a well-known "secret."

218--.text: You can change the names of your assistants and their nickname for you from their Profile menu.

219--.text: You can't do household chores in your staff's stead.

221--.text: Some staff excel in cooking, such as $npcName:11000770$ and $npcName:11000780$.

222--.text: Some staff excel in making drinks, such as $npcName:11000787$ and $npcName:11000779$.

223--.text: Some staff excel in creating necklaces, such as $npcName:11000789$ and $npcName:11000512$.

224--.text: Some staff excel in creating rings, such as $npcName:11000777$ and $npcName:11000544$.

225--.text: $npcName:11000770$'s signature dish is the special unagi dish.

227--.text: $npcName:11000777$ is a descendant of $npcName:11000708$, $npcName:11000075$'s pet cat.

228--.text: $npcName:11000787$ says that he used to work as a bartender, somewhere in $map:02000100$.

229--.text: $npcName:11000791$ is full of stories. Back when he was a hawker, he gossiped wherever he went.

231--.text: Each assistant has a different crafting specialty.

233--.text: Helping Hands is a training agency for youths who dream of making Victoria a better place.

234--.text: You can use a Transparency Badge to selectively hide gear.

235--.text: You can only receive one souvenir buff at a time.

236--.text: If you're feeling grubby, try installing a shower booth in your home.

237--.text: Type "/?" in the chat window to see the chat commands.

238--.text: Let's all use kind and considerate words!

240--.text: $item:40100024$ can be earned by extracting items that are epic or of higher rarity.

241--.text: The guild member limit increases alongside the guild's level, up to a maximum of 100 members.

243--.text: $npcName:11000145$ claims to have come from the future.

248--.text: You can exchange mesos with other player via personal trades. Note that a small percentage will be taken as a handing fee.

249--.text: Although all items can be equipped regardless of your job, weapons belonging to jobs other than your own will only be usable with the X button attack.

250--.text: Items and mesos cannot be gifted through the mail.

252--.text: Type "/search monstername" in the chat window to find information about that particular monster.

253--.text: Use the Rosetta Beauty Salon to wear hats backwards.

254--.text: You can preview how the equipped item will appear by shift+right-clicking the item in the shop.

255--.text: Right-click a different character to view their character info.

256--.text: Type "/changechannel channelnumber" (or /cc) to easily switch channels.

257-RuneBlader-.text: Runeblades strive to reach the pinnacle of strength by combining swordsmanship and rune magic.

258-RuneBlader-.text: Jibricia, the pioneer of rune magic, joined forces with Pelgia, the greatest swordsman in history to create the Runeblade collective known as Terrune Calibre.

259-RuneBlader-.text: The Eight Blades are a group of the greatest Runeblades of their generation.

260-RuneBlader-.text: $npc:11001229$ is the most popular of the Eight Blades, with a fanbase that who admires his righteous disposition and good looks.

261-RuneBlader-.text: Runeblades value the teachings of the Baaz, the spirits of their ancestors who still walk the earth.

262-RuneBlader-.text: Runeblades' techniques are deeply rooted in the teachings of their ancestors, the Baaz.

263-RuneBlader-.text: Runeblades use sharp swords designed for channeling magic, which they call Blades.

264-RuneBlader-.text: Runeblades have the ability to imbue their Blades with the powers of fire, ice, and lightning.

265-RuneBlader-.text: Runeblades can employ the mysterious powers of runes in various combat situations.

266-RuneBlader-.text: Women all over Calibre Island swoon over the gruff $npc:11001229$.

267-RuneBlader-.text: The rumor that $npcName:11001230$ has no belly button is patently false.

268-Fishing-.text: Rumor has it that $npcName:11000781$ caught nothing but prize fish in his time.

269-Fishing-.text: The rumor about $item:40100024$ being an abalone is not true.

270-Fishing-.text: Higher grade fish have a higher chance of breaking free.

271-Fishing-.text: You can fish anywhere there's enough water to swim. You cannot fish while you are swimming, however.

272-Fishing-.text: Bait increases your chance of catching something.

273-Fishing-.text: There's supposedly bait that attracts bigger fish.

274-Fishing-.text: Want to know where fish live? Open the Fish Album.

275-Fishing-.text: The higher a fishing hole's tier, the more difficult it is to gain Fishing Mastery there.

276-Fishing-.text: Different fish can be caught in different areas.

277-Fishing-.text: You can find special items while fishing.

279-Fishing-.text: The higher a fish's grade, the rarer it is.

280-Fishing-.text: The appearance of your float improves as your fishing tier increases.

281-Fishing-.text: Fish aren't the only thing you can catch while fishing.

282-Fishing-.text: Check the World Map tooltip for available fishing holes in different maps and their tiers.

285-Fishing-.text: Want to become a fishing champ? Cast your rod wherever there's water!

286-Fishing-.text: You cannot fish from moving places.

287-Fishing-.text: Rumor has it that there's special bait that attracts rare fish.

288-Fishing-.text: To increase your Fishing Mastery, you must catch fish around your fishing tier.

289-MusicInstrument-.text: The Royal Music Academy's mascots are Ducky and Duckling.

290-MusicInstrument-.text: The Royal Music Academy's president, Didiana, was moved by Ducky's singing and discovered a love for music.

291-MusicInstrument-.text: The Royal Music Academy sells instruments and music scores so that performers can spread the joy of music.

292-MusicInstrument-.text: The Royal Music Academy's administrator, $npcName:11001320$, is good friends with $npcName:11001322$.

293-MusicInstrument-.text: You can purchase music scores made by others and perform them.

294-MusicInstrument-.text: If you have an instrument, you can form an ensemble with nearby party members.

295-MusicInstrument-.text: You can use a blank music score to make your own unique song.

296-MusicInstrument-.text: As your performance mastery increases, you'll do more flourishes while playing music.

297-MusicInstrument-.text: You can improvise your performance without a music score.

298-MusicInstrument-.text: You can use your instrument with a music score to perform.

299-MusicInstrument-.text: When you play an instrument, nearby players will hear your performance.

300-MusicInstrument-.text: If you don't want to hear the performance, lower the Instrument sound in the Sound tab under Environment Settings.

301-MusicInstrument-.text: You cannot hear the performances of blocked characters.

302-MusicInstrument-.text: $npcName:11001320$ in $map:02000001$ sells music scores for the piano and guitar.

303-MusicInstrument-.text: If you want to purchase performance goods, go find $npcName:11001320$ in $map:02000001$.

304-MusicInstrument-.text: If you want to purchase performance goods, go find $npcName:11001322$ in $map:02010002$.

311--.text: After joining a guild, you can earn guild experience through various activities.

320--.text: Guild skills take effect 24 hours after joining a guild.

321--.text: Enjoy events alongside your guild members!

322--.text: Your must wait 24 hours after creating your guild to use the guild arcade.

324-ItemSocketSystem-.text: Gemstones can be dismantled into gem dust, which is used for upgrades.

325-ItemSocketSystem-.text: Gemstones can be upgraded to higher tiers.

326-Mastery-.text: The daily amount of ores that can be obtained through mining depends on the vein.

327-Mastery-.text: When your mining mastery rises, you'll be able to dig up more ores than before.

328-Mastery-.text: Mining mastery increases when you succeed in mining.

329-Mastery-.text: If you want to locate veins that can be mined, check the Mining tab in your Lifestyle menu.

330-Mastery-.text: When you dig up ore by mining, you will gain experience.

331-Mastery-.text: Check the World Map tooltip for available veins in different maps.

332-Mastery-.text: When you use a mining tool to mine, you'll get even more ores.

333-Mastery-.text: Mining tools are made through smithing.

334-Mastery-.text: All veins have a set mastery tier for mining.

335-Mastery-.text: The daily production from ranching depends on the animal.

336-Mastery-.text: When your ranching mastery rises, you'll get more goods from your livestock.

339-Mastery-.text: Collecting goods from ranching will earn you experience.

340-Mastery-.text: In the Ranching tab of the Furnishing menu, you can furnish your livestock pens.

341-Mastery-.text: Using a ranching tool will get you more goods.

342-Mastery-.text: Ranching tools are made through handicrafts.

343-Mastery-.text: All ranching livestock have a mastery tier for feeding.

344-Mastery-.text: When smithing mastery increases, the amount of materials needing for crafting decreases.

345-Mastery-.text: Check the items that can be made through smithing in the Smithing tab of the Lifestyle menu.

346-Mastery-.text: You can earn experience by crafting items via smithing.

347-Mastery-.text: Smithing mastery increases when you craft items.

348-Mastery-.text: Materials to craft items via smithing can be found through mining or ranching.

350-Mastery-.text: View the items that can be made with handicrafting in the Handicraft tab of the Lifestyle menu.

351-Mastery-.text: You gain experience by crafting items with handicrafts.

352-Mastery-.text: Handicraft mastery increases when you craft items.

353-Mastery-.text: You can find handicraft materials through mining and ranching.

366--NA.text: Each assistant is proficient in one of the following crafts: cooking, drink-mixing, necklace-making, or ring-making.

367-AdventureLevel-.text: Once your character reaches level 50, you'll start earning prestige ranks.

368-AdventureLevel-.text: Your prestige rank is shared by all characters on your account.

369-AdventureLevel-.text: Characters Lv. 50+ make progress toward prestige ranks whenever they earn experience.

370-AdventureLevel-.text: Increasing your prestige rank unlocks reward boxes.

371-AdventureLevel-.text: The attribute points unlocked through prestige ranks can only be used on Lv. 50+ characters.

372-AdventureLevel-.text: Prestige rank perks apply to every character on your account.

373-AdventureLevel-.text: There's a limit to how much experience you can earn toward prestige ranks each day.

374-EnchantReformation01-.text: To enchant Epic or above gear at +11, you need some gear identical to the one you're trying to enchant. They'll be used for material.

375-EnchantReformation01-.text: When you fail an enchant, an enchantment charge will be added to the piece of gear you tried to enchant.

376-EnchantReformation01-.text: You can use Toad's Weapon Material in the place of the identical gear item required to enchant certain levels.

377-PetBattle-NA.text: Make sure to feed your pet every day! They'll make you a lot stronger!

378-ItemSocketSystem-NA.text: Accessory gemstones raise your power significantly.

379-FindDungeonHelp-NA.text: Struggling with a dungeon or a raid? Ask for assistance using the Dungeon Helper system!

380-AdventureLevel-NA.text: Don't forget to claim your weekly Prestige Rewards!

381--NA.text: House souvenirs can improve your attack or defense temporarily for free.

382-GuildSystem01-NA.text: Guilds offer useful buffs and rewards for their members!

383-DungeonFindRenewal01-NA.text: Use the Party Finder menu to help you get into an organized group.
